joxy.utils

Class ColorUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • joxy.utils.ColorUtils

  • public class ColorUtils
extends Object
    This class provides some methods to change colors, that is, darken, lighten and shade for example. The implementations of all methods are derived from the implementation of sort-like methods from the KDE codebase. Part of the Joxy Look and Feel.
    Author:
    Thom Castermans, Willem Sonke

      • highThreshold

      • shade

        public static Color shade(Color color,
          float lumaAmount,
          float chromaAmount)
        Adjust the luma and chroma components of a color. The amount is added to the corresponding component.
        Parameters:
        lumaAmount - amount by which to adjust the luma component of the color; 0.0 results in no change, -1.0 turns anything black, 1.0 turns anything white
        chromaAmount - (optional) amount by which to adjust the chroma component of the color; 0.0 results in no change, -1.0 minimizes chroma, 1.0 maximizes chroma
        Returns:
        The resulting color.

      • shade

        public static Color shade(Color color,
          float lumaAmount)
        Refer to documentation of shade(Color, float, float) with chromaAmount = 0.0.

      • luma

        public static float luma(Color color)
        Returns the luminance of the given Java color.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The luminance.

      • backgroundColor

        public static Color backgroundColor(Color color,
                    JComponent c,
                    double centerX,
                    double centerY)
        Returns the background colour of a component with a "slab". Such a background colour is in Oxygen dependent from the position of the component in the window, to let it fit in nicely with the background gradient.

        From Oxygen code: /libs/oxygen/oxygenhelper.h

        Note: this documentation may be incorrect!

        Parameters:
        color - The base colour.
        c - The component to determine the colour for.
        centerX - The x coordinate in c coordinates of the point to use. Most often this will be the center point, hence the name.
        centerY - The y coordinate in c coordinates of the point to use. Most often this will be the center point, hence the name.
        Returns:
        The background colour.

      • mix

        public static Color mix(Color c1,
        Color c2,
        float bias)
        Mixes two given colors.
        Parameters:
        c1 - First color to mix.
        c2 - Second color to mix.
        bias - If this is near 0, c1 is used more, and if this is near 1, c2 is used more.
        Returns:
        Mix of two given colors.

      • calcLightColor

        Returns:
        The calculated color.
